attributes.comment:
Re USCIS-2006-0044
I am a grandmother in an adoption and had to have my fingerprints, etc. done and
REDONE due to too short an expiration date - why it even expires is odd. Next,
more documents will expire. The documents expire partially because of the govt
time lag in processing. We changed countries and needed to have 2 fields
changed on the dossier: it took 2 months and only one field was changed. It took
2 more weeks to get the other field changed. That is 2.5 months to change one
document (it took only 10 days to get the first document through, along with the
fingerprints of 3 people). It takes so very long to get things processed and so
much money that I cannot even fathom why you see the need to add more burden
to us. We had to save, borrow IRA, and remortgage our house for the adoptions.
If you add more or even double more, you will cut us off forever. That cannot be
your purpose, can it? Why not lower the costs, extend the dates, and make it
easier for us? We are good little taxpayers and intend to get more little
taxpayers for you. Please help us out? We have always done what we should
do. Help us. Do not hurt us more.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Carol Green
